page.title: 16Dedham Clubs and Societies
page.content: In Dedham there are the usual clubs and societies, the Women's Institute, Mother's Union, Church Choir, the Amateur Dramatic Club known as the Dedham Players who not only perform plays but are also involved with most local events. Dedham Arts Group holds two exhibitions a year at Littlegarth Studio, which belongs to Miss Mallett, the lady who founded the Littlegarth Private School in 1940, some of the tourists buy the exhibits in this exhibition. There is an Antiques Fair held every month in the Hewitt Hall, where the Littlegarth School now meets. The Hewitt Hall is also the library and is used for meetings and for plays by the Dedham Players. This Hall is shown in some of Constable's paintings and was at one time used for Hunt Balls.
